events.name: Awaken Your Senses! Through Sound Meditation (2/3)
events.description:
"The word LISTEN contains the same letters as the word SILENT."


- Alfred Brendel

In everyday's conversations we often talk but forgot to listen. We often speak, but forgot to hear.Our mind is a clutter of chatters and noises where wisdom doesn't come through.How do we have a clarity of mind? How do we clear the clouds inside our head?What does our heart truly say? How can we hear ourself? How do we connect better?Quantum Zazen is for everyone. It is a place of clarity and connection and where silence speaks the loudest.It is a place where we feel centered, balanced, and focused. It is a place where we know exactly where we are.If you'd like to have a clarity of mind, focus, direction, or answers to your own questions, this place is for you!In this series of Awaken Your Senses meditation, we will focus on our ears to listen to the sounds outside and inside our self.Find your inner strength to leap further in all aspects of your life.Connect to the silence, and find the loudest noise that calls you forward or drag you backward.When: Saturday, 17 June. 08:30 am - 11:00 amWhere: Labrador Park MRTFree of charge! Contributions are welcomed. Register now for the limited seats! @ tinyurl.com/qzazen Check out our page at: www.facebook.com/quantumzazen
events.location: Labrador Park MRT, Labrador Nature Reserve, Singapore 119187

events.name: Maker Faire Open Briefing
events.description:
The Singapore Maker Faire 2017 - Singapore’s biggest show & tell is here! 

Taking place on the 21st and 22nd July at the Singapore Science Centre, makers from all over Southeast Asia will be showcasing their awesome DIY projects and it will be a blast for the whole family!

Now you can be part of the fun too! We are inviting makers from the UWCSEA community to build projects with locally based makers and excite the wider public about the maker movement. We’ll be having an open briefing for incoming makers on the 17th June (9.30am) at the Community Lab@UWCSEA East Campus. 

Here are the project details:
1) Make Arcade Games
Everyone loves games. In this project, we'll be using games as a way to introduce people to the world of making. We'll be creating awesome games that just about anyone can make using materials that can be found around us. We'll be creating an arcade full of games!

2) Make Tools For Mini Makers
We all love using tools like the power drill, hand saw to even the simplest craft knife. But they can be dangerous for anyone using it. Sometimes, we keep young people away from these tools because we are afraid that they might hurt themselves. We'll be designing and making tools safe for kids to use!

3) Make Drill Powered Long Boards
Electric vehicles from unicycles to scooters and hover boards have become one of the main mode of transport in Singapore. However, not everyone can afford buying an electric scooter ranging from $400 to $1000. Come join us as we make a drill powered long board to cruise around during Maker Faire!

4) Detecting Plant Disease using Artificial Intelligence
For some of who love gardening, plant diseases are something we dread. When any sign of diseases emerges, we would quickly attempt to address it and treat the plant. Come join us as we use Computer Vision and Artificial Intelligence technology to detect plant diseases!

Apply now at http://bit.ly/CommLabMF17
For enquiries, please contact Melissa at 97970213 or communitylab@sl2square.org.
events.location: Community Lab at United World College SEA, 1 Tampines Street 73, #01-D119, Singapore 528704

events.name: ArtScience on Screen: Anime Season – Castle in the Sky
events.description:
ArtScience on Screen: Anime Season – Castle in the Sky

Castle in the Sky follows the adventures of young orphans Sheeta and Puza, who make a risky escape from military agents and pirates, in search of a legendary floating castle with their mysterious crystal amulet.

In conjunction with Children’s Season, ArtScience on Screen presents this extraordinary, award-winning animated classic from iconic animation company, Studio Ghibli. Enjoy this masterpiece of astounding visual beauty and imagination from the unrivaled dream factory running this June.

Dates and Screening Times: 
17-25 June: at 10.30am, 12.35pm, 2.40pm, & 4.45pm
Rating: PG
Running time: 2 hours 5 minutes
 
Venue: Expression Gallery, Level 4
Free Admission

#ArtScienceOnScreen
